eu_initiatives:
ESEC's policy priorities are in the following areas: 
 
- Rural Affairs 
- Maritime and Fisheries 
- Employment and skills development 
- Europe 2020 
- White paper on transport 
- Smart cities 
- Energy Union 
- Food and Drink 
- Tourism 
- Cohesion Policy
section: VI - Organisations representing local, regional and municipal authorities, other public or mixed entities, etc.
goals__remit: The East of Scotland European Consortium (ESEC) was established in 1992 to represent the European interests of local authorities in Eastern Scotland. We have membership of 7 Local Authorities within this area (Aberdeen City, Angus, Dundee City, Falkirk, Fife, Perth and Kinross, and Stirling) who collaborate on a shared European agenda. The East of Scotland is an area of contrasting industrial, rural and urban landscapes with significant North Sea coastline.
